availability.description: Surface heat flux input file for faf-heat-NA0pct.
availability.name: Surface heat flux for faf-heat-NA0pct

description: Impose heat flux anomalies to the ocean surface, created from the CMIP5 diagnostic of surface downward heat flux in sea-water (hfds).  The surface heat-flux anomalies are calculated from the ensemble mean of the CMIP5 1pctCO2 simulations at the time of CO2 doubling except that within part of the North Atlantic ocean the perturbation is zero.  Surface flux anomalies (a function of longitude, latitude and time of year) are to remain constant throughout the experiment.  Note that the fluxes themselves are not replaced because this would typically cause a very large climate drift and possible instability.  The method for implementing the heat flux anomaly should follow that used by Bouttes and Gregory (2014).
name: NA0pct 1pctCO2 Heat Flux Anomaly At Doubling
rationale: Heat flux changes are thought to be the main influence on Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation (AMOC) change.
longName: 1pctCO2 ensemble mean surface heat flux anomaly at time of CO2 doubling except that within part of the North Atlantic ocean the perturbation is zero.
keywords: FAFMIP, NA0pct, 1pctCO2, heat flux, 2xCO2, at CO2 doubling
